caption: I didn't like the restaurant, the pizza is dry, hard, it is impossible to bite

I used to love this pizza restaurant because the foods, drinks, staff, and place were magnificent and wonderful. While waiting for my order, I roamed around the place and find it beautiful and clean. Besides,

I’m sorry to say that but the pizza I just ordered is awful((( it costs 40$ but is far from the normal tasty pizza. I ordered one with prosciutto and arugula. The sauce is disgusting, the pizza itself became cold in a couple of minutes. It’s hard to bite a piece because it’s cold and dry((( I wish I didn’t spend money on it. So, 1 Star for the dough, second star is for fast delivery.

Worst restaurant I have been to in Chicago. First time in my life I have had pizza I didn’t like. Terrible service, place was empty, just overall horrendous. No clue how this place has decent reviews.

Liked this place a few years ago and thought I would go back. Terrible experience, food was either cold and undercooked or over cooked to the point it was inedible. Brussels sprouts were chewy and gnocchi was soup soft. I don’t think I’ll go back.
Great experience. Soggy crust.

I had an absolutely wonderful experience here this past weekend! To be honest, my boyfriend and I had intended to go to Pizzeria Bebu, but with an hour and a half wait (no way), we needed to find somewhere else close for some pizza. We had been to Sono before for drinks but decided to walk over and give it a try for dinner. We were seated immediately at the bar and our bartender was awesome. We got a couple of beers, and the burrata for an appetizer. We felt it was lacking in flavor a little bit but still enjoyable. Next we shared the sopressata pizza. It was absolutely incredible. Perfect amount of spice, extremely flavorful meat, and just perfectly cooked pizza. We couldn't have been more pleased. I'll be honest we expected something pretty average but were blown away and would come back 100%, which is very significant to me in terms of Chicago pizza. Also, our bartender heard that it was my birthday and gave my boyfriend and I free beers! So generous! Loved my experience here and I'm excited to go back :)
Food was great and the waiter amazing very friendly and talkative and a tentative

Sono Wood Fired has extremely thin crust pizzas with delicious flavor combinations. They also makes pretty good drinks in a very good appetizers. Quiet during the week so you don't need a reservation. Parking is a little to find.
Place is supposedly open until 10pm, but kitchen was closed by 8:45 on a Thursday.
It's not bad, some of the wines I like aren't here anymore.
Nice quaint  place.
Had a pizza that the bartender recommended. Fantastic.
Not bad place

Overall: With not many pizza options in the immediate area, Sono is a good choice for a light-crust craving.  The good: The pizzas were delicious - the crust was hearty yet airy and flaky. They have a pretty decent selection of topping styles to choose from (pesto and burrata was one), and the portion sizes of the pizzas were well-sized and great for splitting (2 for 4 people was fine). The waiter was friendly and the low-lit ambiance was a nice touch.  The not-so-good: Expensive. Luckily our apps were discounted, but if they weren't it would've been a large bill. Also, the calamari had fried peppers in it. Which, while good, seemed like a cop out to fill the plate.  Food/drink: 8/10 Atmosphere: 8/10 Service: 8/10
Good pizza and drinks

Went with friends but this would be a great place for a date due to the ambience. Pizza and the two apps were pretty good. Our sever was a saint considering someone in our party was being a bit much. Overall it was a good experience and love that you can make reservations.

Pleasantly surprised! Great wine select. Salad was flavorful, complex and filling. I even split it! Pizza was incredible. Fabulous crust, the right consistency not too crispy not too soft. Toppings were fresh and sauce was tasty! If I know any food, it's pizza, and these pies hold up!
Creative and delicious food with friendly service. Mussels appetizer was a great deal
We recently discovered this place - great pizza, tasty food, and today we tried their brunch. Excellent! We will return.
Delicious pizza. Great ambiance. excellent service. The arancini appetizer is very good too. Great place to go before improv.
Delicious pizza, very thin crust, smoky aroma, good service.
Yummy
Great little restaurant. Chill atmosphere!

Como delicio! First time visiting Sono Wood Fire and I will definitely be returning. They have an incredible, not to pass up, Tuesday pizza and pasta deal for $10! We tried the Quattro fromaggio, basil burrata and speck pizza and each was phenomenal-made with top quality fresh ingredient. The atmosphere and staff are so helpful, personable, and friendly. Will definitely be returning!
Not Chicago style but Tavern style and very fresh pizza toppings, like 7 varieties of tomatoes!
So many iconic pizza places in the neighborhood, but this should get more attention. Appetizers and pizzas were elevated. Service was five stars.

If is spelled Sonny, sorry, she was like a blast of sunshine on our first below freezing evening of '18. So I'm sticking with Sunny until we meet again. She was so fast to come up with a homemade warm something with whiskey behind the bar. She was so pleasant that when offered a table we declined and had our meal where we started. We we're sitting away from our large group and had occasional visitors stop by to chat. Her timing with regard to course delivery was served in harmony with our conversations. Impeccably timed interjections. Nick our friends' server was amazing, treating everyone as if they were already longtime friends and patrons. His attitude was solid gold as we were there with a separate long table of no less than 8 kids sitting alone together. He made everyone feel individually special.  We split a salad and pizza. The greens were super fresh and dressed just right. The pizza had a little extra crunch on its crackery crust. Not as light and open than than the typical Neapolitan bordo. Nice...given we there to enjoy the flavor over feeling weighed down, overloaded, or over-salted from a restaurant meal. It was a wonderful wood-fired flat bread with high quality toppings. Great pizza after settling in and getting accustomed to its character around the second slice. The valet was convenient as well. I'm a walking billboard.

favorite wood fired pizza in Chicago. the crust is delicious and they have specials every week night that end up being really great deal. $10 pizza and pasta on Tuesdays. they alsonhave a great wine selection and a good selection on draft. The staff is always warm and helpful.
Had a quiet anniversary dinner here and enjoyed it immensely
Very good bruschetta, nice staff and reasonable

This is a very solid place for good Neapolitan Pizza. The bruschetta are also quite delicious as well as the risotto ball appetizer. Service is friendly and efficient I Allound a good choice for dinner either as a date or with a larger group.

So I came here on a whim because I was in the area with my friend and we couldn't agree on anything other than pizza for dinner. So, after a quick Google search this place came up.  A really nice place, loved the decor and overall vibe. Service was a little slow but it did seem like they were short staffed for the night (no points deducted for that). My waiter/bartender was on point, and went through the drinks and the various options available and offered great suggestions (also hella cute lol). We ended up getting the arancini for the appetizer and the spinach pizza (with ricotta and goat cheese). First of all that pizza just was so fabulous I would honestly go back for that alone. The arancini looked fabulous and had a lovely texture perfectly crispy but it was lacking some serious salt.  I didn't want to deduct any points for that because it could've just been an off night.  I will go back for the fabulous pizza (and the eye candy lol)
$15 for a meatless pasta and no bread sticks. I won't be returning.
Best Meltz In Your Mouth WoodFire Pizza :)  Go here on there $9 Pizza & Pasta Tuesday specials... And Ohhh make some room for dessert/s.  STAFFS ARE A1 TOO !
Was seated and then forgotten... waiter then was too attentive... needs service balance... but great food
Amazing food
Decent service and pizza. Not the best wood fired pizza ever, but good.
The lamb ragu was amazing. I expected to receive a small portion of lamb, but was pleasantly surprised to find a hefty portion, tastefully seasoned with the sauce.
Jonathan is a great bartender, let him recommend your cocktails and wine
Ate dinner here with my best friend and mysteriously we both had severe gastric issues the next day. Not sure if it is related, but won't return.

Great atmosphere, courteous service. Pizza good with thin crust, bruschetta better, look for the fig one or the red sweet pepper. What deserved the 5 stars was the gnocchi: a must have. Good variety of wines. Little pricey but worthy, around 35USD/person including a glass of wine.
Good place for wine and small plates.
Great deals, even better pizza
Excellent service, delicious pizza and great deals!
Very good service and food! Definatley going back to try something else.
This place was very good! We had delicious pastas with generous portions. We also had a very good mushroom pizza. Great service as well. Definitely a great casual Italian restaurant.
Good pizza but slightly overpriced

This had always been one of our favorite restaurants . . . interesting and tasty pizzas, great appetizers, et al.  This last trip was a disaster!  This time we called in an order for carry-out instead of dining in.  I arrived exactly at the estimated time, went to the bar to pay and pick up the order (four pizzas and two appetizers).  The bartender went to the back, and I could see him talking to various people.   He came back empty handed, to say that they gave our order away to another customer.  He asked if they should re-make it.  I said that we had several young kids who needed to eat soon, and was debating, when he said, “well, the people who took it obviously also got the wrong order, so we can see if they bring it back.”  I said that no way would I take an order that left the restaurant and was returned.  I agreed to have them remake the order, as it would take us longer to order from a different restaurant.  I then called my son-in-law, who was parked in their lot (there is no street parking in front of the restaurant).  My son-in-law told the parking lot attendant that he needed to be there for about 20 minutes, as the restaurant made a mistake and had to remake the pizzas.  He was told in no uncertain terms that he was welcome to stay there, but would have to pay the parking fee.  He was upset with this, and told me he would be circling the block waiting for me.  The order came out fairly quickly, I was given a check, and I told the bartender that after their mistakes it was wrong that I was not at least offered something for my trouble.  He replied, “well, I did say I was sorry.”  I think that is unconscionable.  I went outside and called my son-in-law to tell him that I was outside.  It took him about 10 minutes to navigate the traffic around North Ave & Clybourne, by which time (in 14 degree weather) the meal was ice cold.  When we got home with the food, we found that (1) the mozzarella came without the crostini. I know this is just toast, but the fun is spreading the fresh mozzarella on something, and we ended up just eating it plain (not the way it should be served).  Also, (2) none of the pizzas were cut.  Again, not normally a huge deal, but on top of everything else taking more time to find a long knife and cutting the pies just added more time to have the pizzas get cold.  In summary, they totally blew the order, could not communicate with their parking lot, did not include all that was ordered, and having the bartender say “I’m sorry” was insufficient.  If you want good pizza and app’s, by all means go in, but absolutely DO NOT ORDER CARRY-OUT FROM THEM.
Nice pizza!

Sono was a highly rated option my girlfriend and I found after getting a wonderful massage we travel the city looking for excellent food options there are some things to like about this place but we left disappointed and we left quickly we ordered bruschetta brussel sprouts and their two most popular pizzas recommended by the server everything looks clean and fancy ingredients are fresh and high-quality but the execution is chintzy and boring the wild mushroom pizza had a lot of potential with truffle being a highlight but it is boring and the flavors don't stand out the spicy sausage pizza I can't remember the name was quite good but felt like it was missing something my biggest complaint was the bruschetta for $4 you get one piece I couldn't help but think about what the up charge was for that probably in the 300% range we spend $50 and without spending too much more time here there are 15 places I could think of to go to instead and spend less and enjoy more
Great pizza, cocktails, service.
Great place! Amazing servers and pizza!
Great food and fast service for a group of 14!
The pizza and every app was amazing. We we're in a big group and tried lots of things -- this is definitely the way to go!! It's a great spot for a glass of wine, too!
Good pizza!

Pricey for what you get.  Caprese Pizza was eight slices of fresh mozzarella, five tomato slices, and a handful of arugula and a shake of basil.  Crust was good but $19 for that?  High even by Chicago standards
Our favorite pizza place. Great crust from wood fired oven. Try the ciccio pizza in summer - fresh arugula, heirloom tomatoes, yum! Non-pizza items excellent also, esp house made gelato.
Welcoming friendly staff, great food, and great music and ambience
This is one of our go-to fancy pizza places. Excellent specials during the week
Try their burrata and bruschetta. Service was quick and friendly, gave great suggestions when asked.
Love their pizzas. Service is always first-rate.
Our favorite spot, great food with excellent service!
Delicious!
Pizza is fine, but prices are WAY too high for ordinary. Not bad but plenty of better options in the neighborhood
Bruschetta was good!
Very confortable,  kind of fancy and extremely nice staff. The pizza us great!!
Amazing wood cooked pizzas. Top notch in the city full of pie! Great selection of tasty apps, wines & craft beers. One of the best restaurants in the area!!
I liked the pizza but I didn't love it!

Very low key on a Wednesday evening. Really impressed with the Giale pizza - wood roasted butternut squash, radicchio, melted leeks, provolone, fiore di latte, crisp sage... Very creative menu and intimate atmosphere-- perfect for a bite to eat before a show at iO theater, just around the corner.

Having tried a lot of thin crust pizza - both brick oven baked and not, this is by far the best around.  Creative menu, great and reasonably priced wine, friendly staff, I highly recommend this place!  FLOYD A.

I love everything about this place. I usually end up here several times a year and the staff is friendly, welcoming and I think they always remember me. The seasonal caprese salad is the best I've ever had and the pizzas are always amazing. Daily specials are awesome and their selection of bruschettas is out-of-this-world. Atmosphere is cozy. One of my most favorite places in Chicago.

I came here on a date once. They have an okay beer selection, but the cocktails are not to be missed. We had two different pizzas, which we split. The pizza is amazing! Thin bubbly crust, with fresh toppings, piping hot right out of the oven. You can't go wrong! The waitress was a bit short with us, I'm not really sure why. The bartenders were lovely and knowledgeable.
In the neighborhood great thin crust pizza and the daily wine special.

Great location, good food, cool interior. I and my friend ordered spicy sausage pizza, and it was delicious thin crust pizza, even though it was a little bit burned. I got a glass of red from France, it was good as well. It's right in front of the red line stop, North/Clybourn. Nice place to hang out with your friends for drink and small bites.

it was fine but it's not neapolitan style pizza. just know that. it was a huge disappointment to find that out since that's how it was described to me, but it was fine. i wouldn't go back for anything besides 2-1 tuesdays...
Awesome white truffle pizza! Also enjoy the homemade mozzarella cheeses. Good prices for great location.
Excellent pizza and atmosphere.  Fun to go in a big group.  Great food!

Best, most authentic Neapolitan pizza in Chicago. Hands down. Charred, wafer thin crust, flame kissed in the wood burning oven. Great toppings, fresh ingredients. Cannot go wrong here. I love all of the pizzas from simple margarita to more complex creations. My favorite is the spicy calpiccola with charred red onions and spicy sauce. YUM.

The food was gorgeous and the staff was incredibly helpful. We ate at the bar and the bartender Dave was so lovely to chat with. The bruschetta flight was to die for! Be sure to check in on Foursquare for a free bruschetta!

Come here with Steppenwolf Auxiliary Council before plays, and they are accommodating for groups, making sure to get us out in time for the show.  Sono has great wood fired pizzas, and on Tuesday nights it's buy one get one free on pizzas, which is a great deal! Amazing selection of bruscetta, fig, pears, and inventive flavor combinations.  (If you check on on foursquare you can get a free bruscetta!)
Sono is a great addition to our neighborhood. It's reasonably priced they offer social media specials too. Really tasty pizzas, good beer & wine list too. Thumbs up to SoNo
Had the crisp artichokes, cipollini bruschetta, margherita & pancetta pizza.  Everything was pretty good.  The pizza is cooked in a wood & coal fire stove so it has charred flavor.
